p: At the highest concentration gradient used (0.1 mg/mL), ethanol extracts of M. sinensis flesh (145.27 ± 1.94 mg/g) and peel (154.60 ± 1.47 mg/g) and M. paradisiaca flesh (153.81 ± 1.55 mg/g) had the highest ferric reducing power, while the acetone extract of M. paradisiaca peel (155.56 ± 1.81 mg/g) had the greatest ferric reducing power.
